article.description: Loyola of Chicago 89, St. Mary's, Minn. 45
article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 89, St. Mary's, Minn. 45
article.linkText: Loyola of Chicago 89, St. Mary's, Minn. 45
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Justin Cerasoli had a game-high 17 points to lead Loyola of Chicago to a 89-45 rout of St. Mary's of Minnesota on Saturday night. Fourteen players scored for Loyola (5-7). Andy Polka had 13 points, Dave Telander added 12 points and J.R. Blount chipped in 11 points for the Ramblers. Darrin Williams added seven points and 12 rebounds. Loyola hit its first six shots from the field and went on a 42-11 run in the first half en route to a 53-17 halftime lead on 64 percent shooting. St. Mary's (0-9) shot a dismal 24 percent in the first half and 30 percent for the game. Loyola added 35 points off turnovers, compared with two points for St. Mary's. The Ramblers also had 20 fast-break points, while the Cardinals had just four. Will Wright led St. Mary's with 11 points. Lukas Holland added nine.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
